intro: Psychotria cardiomorpha, commonly known as the heartleaf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. Its fruits are small berries that turn red when mature, attracting various bird species. Psychotria cardiomorpha is often found in secondary forests and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
